author: michael resmondo
comment: I have a Haier TV model 48E2500A which is not supported in this app. I use COX as my cable provider but I own TiVo STB's which are not supported by this app. I own a Samsung BlueRay model BD-F5700 which is not supported by this app. I do own an Amazon Dot and I was excited when I found this app but it doesn't work with my components and from looking at the setup it has very few models that it does support. Please notify me if you add my component models to the supported list. BUMMER!

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Does your phone has an infrared blaster?

author: TeleostImpala8 Xbox
comment: I Have a Samsung UE468000 tv and the remote app is Not Connected after turning tv off , On switch turns white so can only turn off!!! TOO MANY ADS AND LOOKING AT THE REVIEWS LOTS OF UNHAPPY TECH SAVVY CUSTOMERS!!!

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Hi, can you tell me which TV do you have exactly. There is a typo in the model name. Note, I can understand all the comments, but I'm not Samsung. There are some TV models that cannot be turned on via network. There is nothing I can do. If you like the app you can turn ads of via in app purchase.

author: Don Garner
comment: Does not work with my Samsung smart tv. Connects over network but nothing works. Links to Alexa but nothing works. Sorry for the bad rating but if a tv is not supported there should be a list somewhere. Edited - j and h model tv's only work with infrared. So if you want to control the tv with infrared only then it will work.

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Hi, there is a list in the app description. Can you tell me which TV do you have? Edit: so I assume that everything is working like written in the app description. Can you tell me what is missing to get a better rating?

author: J Ibble
comment: I like the app,  but it goes to sleep and freezes after a few minutes of my phone being locked. This means Alexa can't control the tv. I have to unlock my phone, close the app and reopen.  Is this a phone setting I need to change?  Samsung edge.  Edit: after a lot of fiddling with battery settings etc I found that the actual fix was:  Settings. Apps. Special access. Optimise.select app. turn off.  Alexa tells me things aren't working sometimes but it still does it.

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Yes it is a power saving mode on your phone. Check in the Android settings. If it is not working, please write me a mail.

comment: This app is great! The developer knows his thing. If you're bitching because of the adds, do yourself a favor and purchase the full version.

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Please write me a mail. This behavior sounds weird.

author: chris g
comment: Edit from previous review. Got the app working by connecting as a K series. Not really sure what defines the series but the app works now. Only channel control don't work since that's controlled by the cable box not TV. But that's not the apps fault.   Model number is: UN50KU630DFXZA Version No: DG10. EDIT: TV comes up as D-series for some reason but D-series on the app doesn't connect to the TV, so I connected as K-series (TV purchased in Dec 2016). That worked but dropped the connection later. Reconnected as M-series and that seemed to work but start getting notices when I turned on the TV that a new HDMI connection existed every time I turned on the TV. not sure if that was App related but it went away when I stopped using the app. Will give it one more try.

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Can you tell me which TV do you have? Edit: Network mode only works with exact one Samsung TV. To control multiple devices at the same time from different manufacturers you need to use infrared, but here you need a phone with an infrared blaster. Edit: If there is still somthing not working, please write me a mail!

author: Kat Beistel
comment: Wouldn't even connect to my vizio smart tv, I have a galaxy s7 so I don't know if it has an infrared blaster. I'm just trying to get this app so I can control my tv with my echo dot

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Can you tell me which TV do you have? Edit: you can control Vizio TVs only via infrared baster. Do you have a phone with an infrared blaster?

author: ferlon whiten
comment: App won't even find my network let alone find my Samsung UE46F6800, whilst using my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge. Total waste of time.

author: James Luke
comment: Downlaoded the app and linked my Samsung TV via Wi-Fi network. Enabled the smart remote tv skill in Alexa, registered in app, search for new device in Alexa smart home. Boom! Worked first time. Only downside is can't turn on tv via Wi-Fi, but that's not a fault of the app.

author: Todd Houseworth
comment: Where to start. The app is weak in design, difficult to manage and doesn't work.  And yes the ads are terrible and irritating

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Hi Todd, thanks for feedback. There is an app description, small tutorial and help videos. You can also write me a mail. If everything is ok with the app you can remove ads via in app purchase.

author: J Wilson
comment: Doesn't seem to work with my Samsung UE40H5500. Says connected (connects with both K and M series) but none of the funcationality work. Are you able to help?

reply.author: adiroid
reply.content: Hi, unfortunately you cannot control your TV, which is a H series, via network, because the communication is encrypted by Samsung. The good news is, with your S5 you can use infrared mode to control your TV, which also work with Amazon echo. So please choose Infrared instead of network and select Samsung H series as your TV. Does it work?
